definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: He looks flat-footed and he can not repair the broken flat iron well.
sentences.chinese: 他看起来笨手笨脚哦，他无法把这个坏了的熨斗修好。

sentences.english: The oaf stumbled over the bucket, spilling all the water.
sentences.chinese: 那个笨手笨脚的人绊到了木桶，把水全给泼了。

sentences.english: But you ought to see what a butterfingers he is out around the house.
sentences.chinese: 可是，你得看看他在家里那种笨手笨脚的样子。

sentences.english: I have got two left feet-I cannot dance.
The men she knew seemed cumbrous compared to him.
sentences.chinese: 所有她认识的男人与他相比都显得笨手笨脚。
他是个笨手笨脚的家伙。

sentences.english: STEFAN: You know, you left that girl alive tonight. That's very clumsy of you.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，你今晚留那女孩一名，太笨手笨脚了。

sentences.english: I don't use knives and forks very often, look, how clumsy I am.
sentences.chinese: 我不经常使用刀叉，瞧我笨手笨脚的。

sentences.english: I'm a klutz when it comes to music.
sentences.chinese: 说到音乐，我可就笨手笨脚了。

sentences.english: She usually does klutzy things when no one else is looking.
sentences.chinese: 在没人看着的时候，她通常做事都是笨手笨脚的。

sentences.english: When I first went to China, I was so ham-fisted that I couldn't even handle chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 刚到中国的时候，我笨手笨脚的，连筷子都不会用。

sentences.english: Flowers and cards, whether sentimental or goofy, are fun.
sentences.chinese: 鲜花和卡片，不论是感性的还是笨手笨脚的，都很好。

sentences.english: The ham actor was ham-fisted after he took a slice of ham.
sentences.chinese: 蹩脚演员吃完一片火腿肉之后变得笨手笨脚。

sentences.english: The wicket-keeper fumbled the ball and dropped it.
sentences.chinese: 那个守门员居然笨手笨脚地脱手失掉了球。

sentences.english: Adie fumbled with the handset in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 阿迪在黑暗中笨手笨脚地握着电话听筒。

sentences.english: Bob seemed all thumbs in doing housework, and all eyes when a football match began.
sentences.chinese: 鲍伯做家务活时笨手笨脚，看起足球赛来则目不转睛。

definition: carelessly and haphazardly/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to be officious/to kibitz/to be meddlesome/to force one's help upon
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to be more of a hindrance than a help
to be in the way/to be a hindrance
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
